definition[0]: a tax on private or industrial wealth that is paid to the government
definition[1]: a tax paid by someone on the value of their property and assets
example[0]: There will be a 2% capital levy increase beginning April 1.
definition[2]: a special tax on wealth, for example when a country is at war or in a dangerous situation
example[1]: He resisted the idea of a capital levy, and Britain paid a high proportion of the costs of the war out of general taxation.
